# HyperBox Beta Testing Program - Launch Package

**Launch Date:** February 19, 2026
**Program Duration:** 8 weeks (Feb 19 - Apr 16, 2026)
**Target Beta Testers:** 10-20 participants
**Status:** Infrastructure 100% Complete - Ready for Recruitment

---

## Quick Start

### For Team Members

1. **Read the Status Report** (15 min)
   - `/s/HyperBox/.github/STREAM3_STATUS_REPORT.md`
   - Comprehensive overview of what's been completed

2. **Start Recruitment This Week** (4-6 hours)
   - Use `BETA_RECRUITMENT.md` for copy-paste ready posts
   - Post to: Twitter/X, Reddit, Dev.to, LinkedIn, GitHub Discussions
   - Target: 10 confirmed testers by Friday EOD

3. **Setup Feedback Systems** (1-2 hours)
   - Create Google Form using `FEEDBACK_COLLECTION.md` template
   - Add form link to recruitment posts
   - Set up mailing list for weekly emails

4. **Monitor & Engage** (ongoing)
   - Track responses in `RECRUITMENT_TRACKER.md`
   - Respond to questions and enrollment inquiries
   - Update Hall of Fame with first contributors

### For Beta Testers

1. **Download HyperBox**
   - Windows: hb.exe + hyperboxd.exe
   - Linux: hb binary for your architecture
   - Source: https://github.com/iamthegreatdestroyer/HyperBox/releases/tag/v0.1.0-alpha

2. **Read the Beta Program Guide** (20-30 min)
   - `/s/HyperBox/.github/BETA_PROGRAM_GUIDE.md`
   - Complete overview of participation expectations and benefits

3. **Complete 5-Step Onboarding** (30 minutes)
   - Install binaries
   - Start daemon
   - Run first container
   - Create a project
   - Join GitHub Discussions

4. **Begin Testing & Provide Feedback**
   - Test your use cases
   - Report bugs via GitHub Issues
   - Suggest features via GitHub Discussions
   - Fill out weekly feedback form

---

```

│   │   └─ Infrastructure overview, timeline, metrics
│   │

│   │   └─ Copy-paste ready recruitment posts
│   │
│   ├── RECRUITMENT_TRACKER.md (Tracking template)
│   │   └─ Sign-ups, outreach metrics, onboarding
│   │
│   ├── FEEDBACK_COLLECTION.md (2.6 KB)
│   │   └─ Survey structure and analysis process
│   │
│   ├── WEEKLY_UPDATE_TEMPLATE.md (1.8 KB)
│   │   └─ Email template for Friday updates
│   │
│   ├── DAILY_SOCIAL_MEDIA.md (2.8 KB)
│   │   └─ 6 post templates + weekly schedule
│   │
│   └── ISSUE_TEMPLATE/
│       ├── BUG_REPORT.md (422 bytes)
│       ├── FEATURE_REQUEST.md (332 bytes)
│       └── QUESTION.md (248 bytes)
│
└── BETA_TESTERS.md (Hall of Fame)
    └─ Recognition document for contributors
```

---

## Key Facts About HyperBox

**What is HyperBox?**
- 20x faster Docker Desktop alternative
- Open source (MIT licensed)
- Built in Rust for maximum performance
- Project-centric container isolation
- Supports: crun, runc, youki, WASM runtimes
- Full CLI + desktop UI

**Current Release:** v0.1.0-alpha (Feb 19, 2026)
- Windows x86_64: hb.exe (5.5 MB)
- Linux x86_64: hb (5.5 MB)
- Linux aarch64: hb (5.3 MB)

**Key Features:**
- Sub-100ms container startup
- Automatic resource management
- Image analysis and deduplication
- Daemon-based architecture
- Comprehensive health monitoring
- 30+ CLI commands

**Download:** https://github.com/iamthegreatdestroyer/HyperBox/releases/tag/v0.1.0-alpha

---

## 8-Week Program Timeline

### Phase 1: Setup & Recruitment (Weeks 1-2)
**Goal:** Recruit 10-20 committed beta testers
- Week 1: Infrastructure complete, recruitment begins
- Week 2: Ramp up recruitment, first testers onboarded

### Phase 2: Initial Testing (Weeks 3-4)
**Goal:** Collect baseline feedback, identify critical issues
- Test core features
- Report bugs and issues
- Suggest improvements

### Phase 3: Iteration & Improvement (Weeks 5-6)
**Goal:** Ship v0.1.1 with improvements
- Address reported bugs
- Implement top feature requests
- Performance optimization

### Phase 4: Stabilization (Weeks 7-8)
**Goal:** Polish and prepare for v0.2.0
- Final testing and validation
- Recognition ceremony
- Transition planning

---

## Critical Success Factors

### Week 1 Priorities

1. **Recruitment (Must Complete)**
   - Post to 6+ channels (Twitter, Reddit, Dev.to, LinkedIn, GitHub, Discord)
   - Target: 3-5 confirmed testers by Feb 25
   - Target: 10+ confirmed testers by Feb 28

2. **Onboarding (Must Complete)**
   - Create feedback form (Google Forms)
   - Set up mailing list
   - Create GitHub Discussions categories
   - Prepare welcome emails

3. **Monitoring (Must Complete)**
   - Track recruitment metrics
   - Monitor social media responses
   - Engage with potential testers
   - Update recruitment tracker daily

### Ongoing Requirements

- **Daily:** Monitor GitHub Issues, Discussions, social media (1-2 hours)
- **Weekly:** Send newsletter, analyze feedback, update Hall of Fame (3-4 hours)
- **Ad-hoc:** Support testers, investigate issues, implement fixes (5-10 hours/week)

## Key Metrics to Track

### Recruitment KPIs
- Confirmed beta testers (target: 10-20)
- Sign-up sources (which channels work best)
- Retention rate (% who remain active)
- Engagement level (average contributions per tester)

### Program Health
- Issue response time (target: <24 hours)
- Feedback quality (1-5 scale)
- Tester satisfaction (weekly survey)
- Net Promoter Score (target: >50)

### Product Impact
- Bugs identified (target: 10+)
- Feature requests (target: 5+)
- Documentation improvements (target: 3+)
- Performance metrics established

## Program Success Definition

### Minimum Success (Mandatory)
- 10 confirmed, active beta testers
- 5+ reported bugs with reproduction steps
- 3+ feature requests from community
- 80%+ positive feedback sentiment

### Target Success (Expected)
- 15 confirmed, active beta testers
- 20+ quality bug reports
- 10+ validated feature requests
- 85%+ positive feedback sentiment
- 2+ external blog posts/reviews

### Exceptional Success (Stretch Goal)
- 20+ confirmed, active beta testers
- 50+ quality bug reports
- 20+ feature requests
- 90%+ positive feedback sentiment
- 5+ external testimonials/reviews
- Recruitment goes viral on social media

---

## Escalation Path

### Issue Escalations

**Priority Level 1: Critical** (Blocks usage)
- Response time: 2 hours
- Owner: Development Lead
- Example: Installation failure on all Windows systems

**Priority Level 2: High** (Breaks major feature)
- Response time: 4-6 hours
- Owner: Developer
- Example: Container isolation not working

**Priority Level 3: Medium** (Minor bug or improvement)
- Response time: 24 hours
- Owner: Product Manager
- Example: CLI help text is unclear

**Priority Level 4: Low** (Nice to have)
- Response time: 48 hours
- Owner: Community Manager
- Example: Feature request for optional logging

### Communication Escalations

**Team Member:** Community Manager → Product Manager
**Product Manager:** Product Manager → Development Lead
**Urgent Issue:** Any → Core Lead

```markdown

- Target: 10-20 beta testers

- Retention: [X]%

- Critical bugs identified: [X]
- Features requested: [X]
- Documentation improvements: [X]
- External testimonials: [X]

1. [Name] - [Contribution]
2. [Name] - [Contribution]
3. [Name] - [Contribution]

## Impact on Product
- Release v0.1.1: [Date]
- Release v0.2.0: [Date]

- Features shipped: [X]

## Lessons Learned
1. [Key insight]
2. [Key insight]
3. [Key insight]

## Recommendations for Future Programs
1. [Recommendation]
2. [Recommendation]
3. [Recommendation]
```
